intro: Decaisnina alata, commonly known as the winged daisies, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, wing-like leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer months. Decaisnina alata is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
